meaningMnemonic: <radical>Flowers</radical> that grow in the <radical>west</radical> are colored by the sun setting so they turn bright red. That's why red flowers that grow in the west are used to make <kanji>red dye</kanji>. They're the closest to the actual color of the red sun, so they're prized by painters and other artists for their perfect color for dye.
readingMnemonic: As you're smashing the flowers into <kanji>red dye</kanji>, a little girl comes up to you and points at the paste. She says, "<reading>赤ね</reading> (あかね)?" (That's red, right?) You look down at the red dye on your fingers and nod. She's right, it is red.
